text: American European relations questioning
global warming and debunking the Bible
good evening this is the New York Times
minute as French president Francois
Hollande begins a state visit the
American French relationship is stronger
than it has been in years but tensions
remain reflected in a broader
frustration between the US and Europe
for example when mr. Obama called off a
strike on Syria it left French planes
gassing up on the runway with people
shivering across the East and freezing
rain expected in the south this week
many can't help asking is global warming
real as experts say don't make the
mistake of judging the long-term climate
like today's weather these cold snaps
are less than half as long as the ones
in the 1970s and using camels to debunk
the Bible radiocarbon dating shows
cameras arrived in Israel during the
last third of the 10th century BC
contradicting the account in Genesis
that they were used hundreds of years
earlier by patriarchs in the kingdom of
David
